Monday, October 1, 2018

5:30 PM

Oct 1, 2018

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the votes
necessary to seek approval from the Massachusetts Department of Revenue of the tax rate for
FY2019.
CMA 2018 #235
RESULT:
12 ORDERS ADOPTED AFTER HEARING HELD [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 2

Oct 1, 2018

II. CALENDAR

ON THE TABLE

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) Awaiting Home Rule Legislation - before proposal can be ordained.
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 10/15/2018 5:00 PM

2. That the proposed Municipal Code entitled “Street Performers” in Section 12.16.170 as amended
on June 25, 2018 by Policy Order #15 be placed on Unfinished Business awaiting revised
ordinance language from the City Solicitor after consultation with the Arts Council based on the
recommendations in the Committee Report dated June 25, 2018.
POR 2018 #182
Councillor Kelley
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 10/15/2018 5:00 PM

Oct 1, 2018

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Meghan Shaw of the Cambridge Energy Alliance, requesting
permission for a temporary banner across JFK Street at Mt. Auburn Street announcing the October is
Green Energy Month, 100% renewable Electricity from October 2, 2018 thru October 29, 2018.
APP 2018 #339
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. An application was received from Cambridge Public Health Department requesting permission for a
temporary banner across 795 Massachusetts Avenue in front of City Hall announcing Cambridge
Family Literacy Fun Day from October 22, 2018 thru November 5, 2018.
APP 2018 #340
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. An application was received from MIT Visual Arts Center requesting permission for fifteen
temporary banners on Ames Street where the List Center is located, to promote the Center’s
upcoming exhibition Introducing Tony Conrad: A Retrospective.
APP 2018 #341
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 4

Oct 1, 2018

IV. COMMUNICATIONS
1. A communication was received from Audrey Schulman, regarding Merrimack Valley explosions and
Feeney Brothers.
COM 592 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. A communication was received from Audrey Cunningham, regarding the immediate freeze of Feeney
Brothers utility services.
COM 593 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

3. A communication was received from Charles Hinds, regarding the proposed cannabis dispensary.
COM 594 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication was received from Peter Valentine, regarding Good Enough.
COM 595 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

5. A communication was received from Peter Valentine, regarding seating in front of our main
government buildings.
COM 596 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

6. A communication was received from Councilor Dennis Carlone, regarding a draft of the city of
Cambridge's Envision process.
COM 591 #2018
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

7. Communication from Naomi Orensten, 66 Reed Street, regarding Policy Order # 1 on food allergies.
COM 597 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 5

Oct 1, 2018

8. Communication from Charles Franklin, 162 Hampshire Street, regarding Policy Order # 4 and safer
roads.
COM 598 #2018
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 6

Oct 1, 2018

Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2018 #297
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2018 #298
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2018 #299
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

RES 2018 #302
RESULT:

RES 2018 #303
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

Oct 1, 2018

Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2018 #314
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 9

Oct 1, 2018

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Department of Human Service Programs, the
Department of Public Works and the Department of Public Health to identify ways to raise awareness
about the prevalence of food allergies and decrease the level of risk posed by food remnants left in
public parks and playgrounds.
POR 2018 #225
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. The City Manager is requested to confer with the Director of the Traffic, Parking and Transportation
Department and any other relevant City departments to install a four-way stop sign at the intersection
of Sixth and Hurley Streets and to work in conjunction with the newly formed East Cambridge
Planning Team Traffic Safety Committee on improving pedestrian and bicycle safety in the East
Cambridge area.
POR 2018 #226
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. That the Government Operations, Rules and Claims Committee schedule a hearing on the proposed
“Cambridge Publicly Financed Municipal Election Program” and the “Cambridge Municipal People’s
Pledge Program” as soon as possible and report back to the City Council with a plan for
implementation no later than the City Council meeting scheduled for November 19, 2018.
POR 2018 #227
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED REFERRED TO GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS, RULES
AND CLAIMS COMMITTEE

4. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the Director of the Traffic, Parking and
Transportation department and any other relevant city departments to study the potential of utilizing
the Icelandic crosswalk design in an intersection in East Cambridge.
POR 2018 #228
Councillor Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 10

Oct 1, 2018

5. That the City Manager is requested to work with any relevant City departments and with the various
programs and facilities that serve Cambridge’s most vulnerable populations, including at food
pantries in the city, to install racks for the purpose of displaying brochures and/or information
regarding the various city programs that support vulnerable residents.
POR 2018 #229
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Mallon, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with the appropriate City personnel to seek
a formal response from CVS as it relates to a racial profiling incident.
POR 2018 #230
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

7. That the Envision Cambridge draft recommendations should be reviewed by the entire City Council
in respective committees.
POR 2018 #231
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS ON ORDER
AS AMENDED
Next: 10/15/2018 5:00 PM

8. Recognition to those who brought the MLK School construction to a successful completion.
POR 2018 #232
Councillor Zondervan, Mayor McGovern, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

9. That the City Council go on record in recognizing October as National Domestic Violence Awareness
Month, and support the reauthorization of the Violence Against Women Act.
POR 2018 #233
Councillor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

10. Traffic, Parking and Transportation Department to provide the City Council with a list of streets
where it is recommended that the speed be reduced to 20 MPH
POR 2018 #234
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 11

Oct 1, 2018
